content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at position (0.0, 0.0)
Use-case: Smelting basic materials.
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace (position: (0.0, 0.0))
– Iron Chest (position: (1.5, 0.5))

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at position (–16.0, –51.0)
Use-case: Extraction and preliminary processing of iron ore.
Consists of:
– Burner Mining Drill (position: (–16.0, –51.0)) [Refueled in Step 1106; output blockage warning remains]
– Burner Inserter (position: (–14.5, –49.5))
  • Pickup: (–15.5, –49.5)
  • Drop: (–13.5, –49.5)
– Transport Belt (position: (–15.5, –49.5))
– Iron Chest (output sink) (position: (–13.5, –49.5))
– Burner Inserter (position: (–14.5, –47.5))
  • Associated Iron Chest: (–13.5, –47.5)
– Fast Inserter (position: (–12.5, –49.5)) [Re-placed in Steps 1107–1108 and re-connected via power poles]
– Sink Inserter (position: (–13.5, –45.5))
  • Pickup: (–13.5, –46.5)
  • Drop: (–13.5, –44.5)
– Belt Group connecting fast inserter drop (position: (–11.5, –49.5)) to sink inserter pickup (position: (–13.5, –46.5))

### Copper Furnace at position (–27.0, –60.0)
Use-case: Processing copper ore.
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace (position: (–27.0, –60.0))
  [Warning: no ingredients to smelt]

### Lab Power Integration System at position (0.5, 2.5)
Use-case: Supporting research through integrated power and fluid supply.
Consists of:
– Lab (position: (0.5, 2.5))
– Offshore Pump (original) (position: (–7.5, 25.5))
– Offshore Pump (new) (position: (–9.5, 24.5))
  [Connected to Boiler for water supply]
– Boiler (position: (2.0, 17.5))
  [Fueled and operational with energy: 2000; after successful refuel operations in Steps 1123–1127]
– Steam Engine (position: (2.5, 27.5), direction: RIGHT)
  [Repositioned from inventory in Steps 1120–1121; connected via pipes to the Boiler and powered through a pole at (2.5, 30.5); no warnings]

### Pipe Production Facility at position (3.5, 0.5)
Use-case: Manufacturing of pipes.
Consists of:
– Assembling Machine (position: (3.5, 0.5))
  [Warning: not receiving electricity; missing resource: iron-plate]
– Iron Chest (position: (1.5, 0.5))
– Electricity Network via Small Electric Poles (e.g., at positions (3.5, –1.5), (3.5, 2.5), (4.5, 3.5), …)

### Fluid Pipelines (Pipe Groups)
Use-case: Interconnecting fluid transport components.
Consists of:
– Multiple PipeGroups distributed across the map (e.g., positions (8.5, 5.5), (10.5, 4.5), (2.5, 9.5), etc.)
– A working PipeGroup connecting the new offshore pump (position: (–9.5, 24.5)) to the Boiler
– A newly established PipeGroup linking the Boiler (position: (2.0, 17.5)) to the Steam Engine (position: (2.5, 27.5))

### Integrated Components
Use-case: Facilitate power distribution and integration of mined resources.
Consists of:
– Belt connections linking the Burner Mining Drill’s output (via fast inserter drop at (–11.5, –49.5)) to sink inserter pickup (at (–13.5, –46.5))
– Electricity Network formed by Small Electric Poles:
  • Existing pole (position: (–12.5, –48.5))
  • Additional pole (position: (–10.5, –49.5)) placed in Step 1104
  • Pole (position: (–12.5, –50.5)) connected with the re-placed fast inserter
  • (Previously, a pole at (5.5, 8.5) served the original Steam Engine)
  • New power pole (position: (2.5, 30.5)) now connected to the repositioned Steam Engine

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
• Steam Engine Placement and Crafting Issues
  – Verify that the required item exists in inventory before placement.
  – Ensure sufficient production and resource throughput when crafting or repositioning high-tier items like Steam Engines.

• Pipe Connection Resource Shortage
  – Confirm pipe inventory availability before initiating fluid connections; replenish resources to meet connection requirements.

• Name Reference and Variable Usage
  – Use correctly defined variable names when referencing entities to prevent retrieval errors.

• Transport Belt Connection Errors
  – Ensure transport belts are available and that connection paths are free from obstructions.

• Entity Placement Conflicts and Distance Issues
  – Verify that the target tile is unoccupied and within the acceptable distance prior to placement.

• Output Sink Configuration Issues
  – Accurately align inserters with their designated sink entities.

• Power Supply Connection Handling
  – Check that power-dependent entities are properly connected to an active electricity network.

• Fluid Connectivity and Intermediate Placement
  – Maintain clear, unobstructed connection points for pipelines to ensure proper fluid transfer.

• Crafting and Furnace Resource Shortages
  – Monitor and supply all necessary raw materials and fuel to avoid production interruptions.

• Entity Retrieval and Repositioning Errors
  – Ensure that positions provided to get_entity match the current location of placed entities.
  – If retrieval fails, confirm whether the entity has been repositioned and use inventory placement as a fallback.

• Boiler Fueling Inconsistencies
  – Continuously monitor the boiler’s energy level and fuel warnings.
  – Insert adequate fuel (e.g., coal) to maintain steady steam generation and prevent recurrent out‐of‐fuel conditions.

────────────────────────
NAMESPACE
• get_entity(entity: Any, position: Any) -> Any  
  – Retrieves an entity of the specified type at the given position.  
   • Success: Returns the located entity.  
   • Failure: Raises an exception if not found.

• pipe_entity(pipe: entities.Pipe) -> Any  
  – Processes a pipe entity during pipeline connection routines.

• rotate_entity(entity: Any, direction: Any) -> Any  
  – Rotates the given entity to the specified direction for proper alignment.

• insert_item(resource: Any, target: Any, quantity: int) -> Any  
  – Inserts a specified quantity of a resource into the target inventory.

• get_connection_amount(virtual_candidate: Any, boiler_connection: Any, pipe_proto: Prototype.Pipe) -> int  
  – Calculates the number of pipe segments required to establish a fluid connection.

• place_entity_next_to(entity_type: Any, reference_position: Position, direction: Direction, spacing: int) -> Any  
  – Attempts to place an entity adjacent to the reference position using the specified direction and spacing.  
   • Success: Demonstrated by the correct placement (e.g., adjusted fast inserter spacing).  
   • Failure: Occurs if a collision is detected.

Important Variables:
• pump_working (OffshorePump) – Holds the offshore pump entity at position (–7.5, 25.5).
• boiler_original (Boiler) – Represents the boiler entity at position (2.0, 17.5).
• candidate_intermediate_offpump (Position) – Candidate connection point for linking the Offshore Pump.
• candidate_intermediate_boiler (Position) – Candidate connection point for linking the Boiler.
• boiler_connection_point (Position) – Intended connection point for the boiler’s water supply.
• steam_engine_connection_point (Position) – Reflects the repositioned Steam Engine location at (2.5, 27.5).
• pipe_count (int) – Tracks the current number of available pipes.
• distance (float) – Calculated distance for pipeline segments.
• final_inventory (Inventory) – Snapshot of inventory after recent operations.
• virtual_candidate (Position) – Virtual candidate connection point used for manual pipe placement.
